codeSystems.name: FHIRVersion
codeSystems.title: FHIRVersion
codeSystems.description: All published FHIR Versions.

codeSystems.name: BindingStrength
codeSystems.title: BindingStrength
codeSystems.description: Indication of the degree of conformance expectations associated with a binding.

codeSystems.name: CodeSystemContentMode
codeSystems.title: CodeSystemContentMode
codeSystems.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in a code system resource.

codeSystems.name: CodeSystemHierarchyMeaning
codeSystems.title: CodeSystemHierarchyMeaning
codeSystems.description: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts in a code system.

codeSystems.name: PropertyType
codeSystems.title: PropertyType
codeSystems.description: The type of a property value.

codeSystems.name: ConstraintSeverity
codeSystems.title: ConstraintSeverity
codeSystems.description: SHALL applications comply with this constraint?

codeSystems.name: DataType
codeSystems.title: DataType
codeSystems.description: A version specific list of the data types defined by the FHIR specification for use as an element  type (any of the FHIR defined data types).

codeSystems.name: DiscriminatorType
codeSystems.title: DiscriminatorType
codeSystems.description: How an element value is interpreted when discrimination is evaluated.

codeSystems.name: ExtensionContextType
codeSystems.title: ExtensionContextType
codeSystems.description: How an extension context is interpreted.

codeSystems.name: FilterOperator
codeSystems.title: FilterOperator
codeSystems.description: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter.

codeSystems.name: GroupType
codeSystems.title: GroupType
codeSystems.description: Types of resources that are part of group.

codeSystems.name: GuidePageGeneration
codeSystems.title: GuidePageGeneration
codeSystems.description: A code that indicates how the page is generated.

codeSystems.name: GuideParameterCode
codeSystems.title: GuideParameterCode
codeSystems.description: Code of parameter that is input to the guide.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.title: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

codeSystems.name: PropertyRepresentation
codeSystems.title: PropertyRepresentation
codeSystems.description: How a property is represented when serialized.

codeSystems.name: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.title: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

codeSystems.name: ReferenceVersionRules
codeSystems.title: ReferenceVersionRules
codeSystems.description: Whether a reference needs to be version specific or version independent, or whether either can be used.

codeSystems.name: AggregationMode
codeSystems.title: AggregationMode
codeSystems.description: How resource references can be aggregated.

codeSystems.name: SlicingRules
codeSystems.title: SlicingRules
codeSystems.description: How slices are interpreted when evaluating an instance.

codeSystems.name: ResourceType
codeSystems.title: ResourceType
codeSystems.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

codeSystems.name: SPDXLicense
codeSystems.title: SPDXLicense
codeSystems.description: The license that applies to an Implementation Guide (using an SPDX license Identifiers, or 'not-open-source'). The binding is required but new SPDX license Identifiers are allowed to be used (https://spdx.org/licenses/).

codeSystems.name: StructureDefinitionKind
codeSystems.title: StructureDefinitionKind
codeSystems.description: Defines the type of structure that a definition is describing.

codeSystems.name: TypeDerivationRule
codeSystems.title: TypeDerivationRule
codeSystems.description: How a type relates to its baseDefinition.

codeSystems.name: LOINC
codeSystems.title: Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC)
codeSystems.description: LOINC provides a set of universal names and ID codes for identifying laboratory and clinical test results.1,2 LOINC facilitates the exchange and pooling of results, such as blood hemoglobin, serum potassium, or vital signs, for clinical care, outcomes management, and research. LOINC's universal identifiers (names and codes) can be used in the context of order and observation exchanges between information systems that use syntax standards such as HL73, CEN TC251, ISO TC215, ASTM4, and DICOM. Specifically, the identifier can be used as the coded value for an observation in any other standard that uses the observation/observation value paradigm, whether messages, documents, application programming interface (API), etc. For example, LOINC codes are used widely in the OBX segment Observation Identifier field (OBX-3) of an ORU HL7 (HL7 version 2.x or ASTM 1238-9410) message that may be sent between a Clinical Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) and Electronic Health Record Systems (EHR).5, 6 In this way, LOINC codes provide universal identifiers that allow the exchange of clinical data between heterogeneous computing environments.

codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

codeSystems.name: CompositeMeasureScoring
codeSystems.title: CompositeMeasureScoring
codeSystems.description: The composite scoring method of the measure.

codeSystems.name: DefinitionTopic
codeSystems.title: DefinitionTopic
codeSystems.description: High-level categorization of the definition, used for searching, sorting, and filtering.

codeSystems.name: DefinitionUseCodes
codeSystems.title: Structure Definition Use Codes / Keywords
codeSystems.description: Structure Definition Use Codes / Keywords

codeSystems.name: MeasureDataUsage
codeSystems.title: MeasureDataUsage
codeSystems.description: The intended usage for supplemental data elements in the measure.

codeSystems.name: MeasureImprovementNotation
codeSystems.title: MeasureImprovementNotation
codeSystems.description: Observation values that indicate what change in a measurement value or score is indicative of an improvement in the measured item or scored issue.

codeSystems.name: MeasurePopulationType
codeSystems.title: MeasurePopulationType
codeSystems.description: The type of population.

codeSystems.name: MeasureScoring
codeSystems.title: MeasureScoring
codeSystems.description: The scoring type of the measure.

codeSystems.name: MeasureType
codeSystems.title: MeasureType
codeSystems.description: The type of measure (includes codes from 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20368).

codeSystems.name: IdentifierType
codeSystems.title: identifierType
codeSystems.description: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying type of identifier. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging data types CX, PLN, PPN, XCN and XON.

codeSystems.name: Ietf3066
codeSystems.title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
codeSystems.description: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.

codeSystems.name: ISO3166Part1
codeSystems.title: ISO 3166-1 Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions — Part 1: Country code
codeSystems.description: ISO 3166-1 establishes codes that represent the current names of countries, dependencies, and other areas of particular geopolitical interest, on the basis of country names obtained from the United Nations.

codeSystems.name: Iso3166_2
codeSystems.title: ISO 3166 Part 2 Country Subdivision Codes
codeSystems.description: Identifies the coding system published in the ISO 3166-2 Standard for Country Subdivision codes. This standard is released periodically, and a new OID will be assigned by ISO for new editions.
